<Link id="l00403" /><CodeLine lineNumber="403"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// If we do not reserve stack space for outgoing arguments in prologue,</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00404" /><CodeLine lineNumber="404"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// we will adjust the stack pointer before call instruction. After the</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>

<Link id="l00822" /><CodeLine lineNumber="822"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// Skip to before the spills of scalar callee-saved registers</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00823" /><CodeLine lineNumber="823"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// FIXME: assumes exactly one instruction is used to restore each</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00824" /><CodeLine lineNumber="824"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// callee-saved register.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00825" /><CodeLine lineNumber="825"><Highlight kind="normal">  <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/target/lib/target/arm/armslshardening-cpp/#ad5f691fdc1a09aaf6df5fef958b35a3d">MBBI</a> = std::prev(<a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/target/lib/target/arm/armslshardening-cpp/#ad5f691fdc1a09aaf6df5fef958b35a3d">MBBI</a>, <a href="#a857ca8ebd4e64059aa8774f14445e414">getRVVCalleeSavedInfo</a>(MF, CSI).<a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/target/lib/target/nvptx/nvvmreflect-cpp/#ac934769d93af95250952646a3829df4c">size</a>() +</Highlight></CodeLine>

<Link id="l00827" /><CodeLine lineNumber="827"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00828" /><CodeLine lineNumber="828"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// If libcalls are used to spill and restore callee-saved registers, the frame</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00829" /><CodeLine lineNumber="829"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// has two sections; the opaque section managed by the libcalls, and the</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00830" /><CodeLine lineNumber="830"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// section managed by MachineFrameInfo which can also hold callee saved</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00831" /><CodeLine lineNumber="831"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// registers in fixed stack slots, both of which have negative frame indices.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00832" /><CodeLine lineNumber="832"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// This gets even more complicated when incoming arguments are passed via the</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00833" /><CodeLine lineNumber="833"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// stack, as these too have negative frame indices. An example is detailed</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00834" /><CodeLine lineNumber="834"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// below:</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00835" /><CodeLine lineNumber="835"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">//</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00836" /><CodeLine lineNumber="836"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">//  | incoming arg | &lt;- FI&#91;-3&#93;</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00837" /><CodeLine lineNumber="837"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">//  | libcallspill |</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00838" /><CodeLine lineNumber="838"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">//  | calleespill  | &lt;- FI&#91;-2&#93;</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00839" /><CodeLine lineNumber="839"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">//  | calleespill  | &lt;- FI&#91;-1&#93;</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00840" /><CodeLine lineNumber="840"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">//  | this&#95;frame   | &lt;- FI&#91;0&#93;</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00841" /><CodeLine lineNumber="841"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">//</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00842" /><CodeLine lineNumber="842"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// For negative frame indices, the offset from the frame pointer will differ</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00843" /><CodeLine lineNumber="843"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// depending on which of these groups the frame index applies to.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00844" /><CodeLine lineNumber="844"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// The following calculates the correct offset knowing the number of callee</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00845" /><CodeLine lineNumber="845"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// saved registers spilt by the two methods.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>

<Link id="l01202" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1202"><Highlight kind="normal">    </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// Use available stack adjustment in pop instruction to deallocate stack</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01203" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1203"><Highlight kind="normal">    </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// space. Align the stack size down to a multiple of 16 This is needed for</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01204" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1204"><Highlight kind="normal">    </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// RVE.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>

<Link id="l01206" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1206"><Highlight kind="normal">    uint64&#95;t Spimm =</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01207" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1207"><Highlight kind="normal">        std::min(<a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/#a41896492f62ee8d25cf8aaad70bd88aa">alignDown</a>(StackSize, 16), </Highlight><Highlight kind="keyword">static&#95;cast&lt;</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal">uint64&#95;t</Highlight><Highlight kind="keyword">&gt;</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal">(48));</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01208" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1208"><Highlight kind="normal">    <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/target/lib/target/arm/armslshardening-cpp/#ad5f691fdc1a09aaf6df5fef958b35a3d">MBBI</a>-&gt;getOperand(1).setImm(Spimm);</Highlight></CodeLine>

<Link id="l01461" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1461"><Highlight kind="normal">    <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/target/lib/target/amdgpu/silowercontrolflow-cpp/#a4868c5d81c5ccc98c47aeab6244346a0">assert</a>(ObjectsToAllocate.<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/smallvectortemplatecommon/#ad9a3c7bc26b130377bbafc170b5f88a2">empty</a>() &amp;&amp;</Highlight></CodeLine>

<Link id="l01467" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1467"><Highlight kind="normal">  int64&#95;t <a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/#a05f5b9a11bdcc5feba62899f95dcf878a3134224cba2545bc57954d3b072aebb4">Offset</a> = 0;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01468" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1468"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordflow">for</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> (</Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordtype">int</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> FI : ObjectsToAllocate) &#123;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01469" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1469"><Highlight kind="normal">    </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// ObjectSize in bytes.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01470" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1470"><Highlight kind="normal">    int64&#95;t ObjectSize = MFI.<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/machineframeinfo/#a9284fd53296d2a2f8ae654d000971000">getObjectSize</a>(FI);</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01471" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1471"><Highlight kind="normal">    </Highlight><Highlight kind="keyword">auto</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> ObjectAlign =</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01472" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1472"><Highlight kind="normal">        std::max(<a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/amdgpu/hsamd/kernel/arg/key/#a6b334a5f83504ebc99cc59f4f333ff98">Align</a>(<a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/riscv/#ad53ed145f88b1e1c966ff68df9029e7f">RISCV::RVVBitsPerBlock</a> / 8), MFI.<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/machineframeinfo/#a8320a54de0a273478de910ac3795058b">getObjectAlign</a>(FI));</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01473" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1473"><Highlight kind="normal">    </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// If the data type is the fractional vector type, reserve one vector</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01474" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1474"><Highlight kind="normal">    </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// register for it.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01475" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1475"><Highlight kind="normal">    </Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordflow">if</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> (ObjectSize &lt; (<a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/riscv/#ad53ed145f88b1e1c966ff68df9029e7f">RISCV::RVVBitsPerBlock</a> / 8))</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01476" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1476"><Highlight kind="normal">      ObjectSize = (<a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/riscv/#ad53ed145f88b1e1c966ff68df9029e7f">RISCV::RVVBitsPerBlock</a> / 8);</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01477" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1477"><Highlight kind="normal">    <a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/#a05f5b9a11bdcc5feba62899f95dcf878a3134224cba2545bc57954d3b072aebb4">Offset</a> = <a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/#ab102f0f12dd38aeea5906b1d80c792ff">alignTo</a>(<a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/#a05f5b9a11bdcc5feba62899f95dcf878a3134224cba2545bc57954d3b072aebb4">Offset</a> + ObjectSize, ObjectAlign);</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01478" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1478"><Highlight kind="normal">    MFI.<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/machineframeinfo/#a3cd29e7edbcaceb5834eaa7d089a5bc4">setObjectOffset</a>(FI, -<a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/#a05f5b9a11bdcc5feba62899f95dcf878a3134224cba2545bc57954d3b072aebb4">Offset</a>);</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01479" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1479"><Highlight kind="normal">    </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// Update the maximum alignment of the RVV stack section</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01480" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1480"><Highlight kind="normal">    RVVStackAlign = std::max(RVVStackAlign, ObjectAlign);</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01481" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1481"><Highlight kind="normal">  &#125;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01482" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1482"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01483" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1483"><Highlight kind="normal">  uint64&#95;t StackSize = <a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/#a05f5b9a11bdcc5feba62899f95dcf878a3134224cba2545bc57954d3b072aebb4">Offset</a>;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01484" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1484"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01485" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1485"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// Ensure the alignment of the RVV stack. Since we want the most-aligned</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01486" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1486"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// object right at the bottom (i.e., any padding at the top of the frame),</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01487" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1487"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// readjust all RVV objects down by the alignment padding.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01488" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1488"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// Stack size and offsets are multiples of vscale, stack alignment is in</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01489" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1489"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// bytes, we can divide stack alignment by minimum vscale to get a maximum</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01490" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1490"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// stack alignment multiple of vscale.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01491" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1491"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="keyword">auto</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> VScale =</Highlight></CodeLine>

<Link id="l01550" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1550"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// Originally, the function will scan all the stack objects to check whether</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01551" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1551"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// if there is any scalable vector object on the stack or not. However, it</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01552" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1552"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// causes errors in the register allocator. In issue 53016, it returns false</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01553" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1553"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// before RA because there is no RVV stack objects. After RA, it returns true</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01554" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1554"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// because there are spilling slots for RVV values during RA. It will not</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01555" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1555"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// reserve BP during register allocation and generate BP access in the PEI</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01556" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1556"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// pass due to the inconsistent behavior of the function.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01557" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1557"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">//</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01558" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1558"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// The function is changed to use hasVInstructions() as the return value. It</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01559" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1559"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// is not precise, but it can make the register allocation correct.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01560" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1560"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">//</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01561" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1561"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// FIXME: Find a better way to make the decision or revisit the solution in</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01562" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1562"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// D103622.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01563" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1563"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">//</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>

<Link id="l01573" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1573"><Highlight kind="normal">      </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// Far branches over 20-bit offset will be relaxed in branch relaxation</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01574" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1574"><Highlight kind="normal">      </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// pass. In the worst case, conditional branches will be relaxed into</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01575" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1575"><Highlight kind="normal">      </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// the following instruction sequence. Unconditional branches are</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>

<Link id="l01577" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1577"><Highlight kind="normal">      </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// branch instruction.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01578" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1578"><Highlight kind="normal">      </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">//</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01579" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1579"><Highlight kind="normal">      </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">//        foo</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01580" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1580"><Highlight kind="normal">      </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">//        bne     t5, t6, .rev&#95;cond # &#96;TII-&gt;getInstSizeInBytes(MI)&#96; bytes</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01581" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1581"><Highlight kind="normal">      </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">//        sd      s11, 0(sp)        # 4 bytes, or 2 bytes in RVC</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01582" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1582"><Highlight kind="normal">      </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">//        jump    .restore, s11     # 8 bytes</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01583" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1583"><Highlight kind="normal">      </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// .rev&#95;cond</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01584" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1584"><Highlight kind="normal">      </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">//        bar</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01585" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1585"><Highlight kind="normal">      </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">//        j       .dest&#95;bb          # 4 bytes, or 2 bytes in RVC</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01586" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1586"><Highlight kind="normal">      </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// .restore:</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01587" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1587"><Highlight kind="normal">      </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">//        ld      s11, 0(sp)        # 4 bytes, or 2 bytes in RVC</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>

<Link id="l01589" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1589"><Highlight kind="normal">      </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">//        baz</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>

<Link id="l01705" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1705"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01706" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1706"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// We would like to split the SP adjustment to reduce prologue/epilogue</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01707" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1707"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// as following instructions. In this way, the offset of the callee saved</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01708" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1708"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// register could fit in a single store. Supposed that the first sp adjust</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01709" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1709"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// amount is 2032</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01710" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1710"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">//   add     sp,sp,-2032</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01711" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1711"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">//   sw      ra,2028(sp)</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01712" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1712"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">//   sw      s0,2024(sp)</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01713" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1713"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">//   sw      s1,2020(sp)</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01714" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1714"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">//   sw      s3,2012(sp)</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01715" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1715"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">//   sw      s4,2008(sp)</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01716" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1716"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">//   add     sp,sp,-64</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01717" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1717"><Highlight kind="normal">uint64&#95;t</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01718" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1718" lineLink="/docs/api/classes/llvm/riscvframelowering/#a16cde5f8fc9f15e96e996e063f1dcb9c"><Highlight kind="normal"><a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/riscvframelowering/#a16cde5f8fc9f15e96e996e063f1dcb9c">RISCVFrameLowering::getFirstSPAdjustAmount</a>(</Highlight><Highlight kind="keyword">const</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/machinefunction">MachineFunction</a> &amp;MF)</Highlight><Highlight kind="keyword"> const </Highlight><Highlight kind="normal">&#123;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01719" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1719"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="keyword">const</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> </Highlight><Highlight kind="keyword">auto</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> &#42;RVFI = MF.<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/machinefunction/#ab7feae1932b436c8630e247166ec42b7">getInfo</a>&lt;<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/riscvmachinefunctioninfo">RISCVMachineFunctionInfo</a>&gt;();</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01720" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1720"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="keyword">const</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/machineframeinfo">MachineFrameInfo</a> &amp;MFI = MF.<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/machinefunction/#a54f334a9c8ca6d105eae383ae87e4524">getFrameInfo</a>();</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01721" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1721"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="keyword">const</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> std::vector&lt;CalleeSavedInfo&gt; &amp;CSI = MFI.getCalleeSavedInfo();</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01722" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1722"><Highlight kind="normal">  uint64&#95;t StackSize = <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/riscvframelowering/#afc745007e032dc7daac0eb03fbd9f0f1">getStackSizeWithRVVPadding</a>(MF);</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01723" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1723"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01724" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1724"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// Disable SplitSPAdjust if save-restore libcall is used. The callee-saved</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01725" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1725"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// registers will be pushed by the save-restore libcalls, so we don&#39;t have to</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01726" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1726"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// split the SP adjustment in this case.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01727" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1727"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordflow">if</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> (RVFI-&gt;getReservedSpillsSize())</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01728" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1728"><Highlight kind="normal">    </Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordflow">return</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> 0;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01729" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1729"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01730" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1730"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// Return the FirstSPAdjustAmount if the StackSize can not fit in a signed</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01731" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1731"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// 12-bit and there exists a callee-saved register needing to be pushed.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01732" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1732"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordflow">if</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> (!<a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/#a1a1e51a5952c3afa00875df90e7ae6f8">isInt&lt;12&gt;</a>(StackSize) &amp;&amp; (CSI.size() &gt; 0)) &#123;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01733" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1733"><Highlight kind="normal">    </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// FirstSPAdjustAmount is chosen at most as (2048 - StackAlign) because</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01734" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1734"><Highlight kind="normal">    </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// 2048 will cause sp = sp + 2048 in the epilogue to be split into multiple</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01735" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1735"><Highlight kind="normal">    </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// instructions. Offsets smaller than 2048 can fit in a single load/store</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01736" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1736"><Highlight kind="normal">    </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// instruction, and we have to stick with the stack alignment. 2048 has</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01737" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1737"><Highlight kind="normal">    </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// 16-byte alignment. The stack alignment for RV32 and RV64 is 16 and for</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01738" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1738"><Highlight kind="normal">    </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// RV32E it is 4 So (2048 - StackAlign) will satisfy the stack alignment.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01739" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1739"><Highlight kind="normal">    </Highlight><Highlight kind="keyword">const</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> uint64&#95;t StackAlign = <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/targetframelowering/#a74d93035f53f5e8c2aaea5a8f307972d">getStackAlign</a>().<a href="/docs/api/structs/llvm/align/#a80735739b49cf97a491922c8f9af2cc1">value</a>();</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01740" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1740"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01741" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1741"><Highlight kind="normal">    </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// Amount of (2048 - StackAlign) will prevent callee saved and restored</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01742" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1742"><Highlight kind="normal">    </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// instructions be compressed, so try to adjust the amount to the largest</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01743" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1743"><Highlight kind="normal">    </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// offset that stack compression instructions accept when target supports</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01744" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1744"><Highlight kind="normal">    </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// compression instructions.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01745" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1745"><Highlight kind="normal">    </Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordflow">if</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> (<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/riscvframelowering/#a8682aca3721b6e3f6152ad82b053e209">STI</a>.hasStdExtCOrZca()) &#123;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01746" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1746"><Highlight kind="normal">      </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// The compression extensions may support the following instructions:</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01747" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1747"><Highlight kind="normal">      </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// riscv32: c.lwsp rd, offset&#91;7:2&#93; =&gt; 2^(6 + 2)</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01748" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1748"><Highlight kind="normal">      </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">//          c.swsp rs2, offset&#91;7:2&#93; =&gt; 2^(6 + 2)</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01749" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1749"><Highlight kind="normal">      </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">//          c.flwsp rd, offset&#91;7:2&#93; =&gt; 2^(6 + 2)</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01750" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1750"><Highlight kind="normal">      </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">//          c.fswsp rs2, offset&#91;7:2&#93; =&gt; 2^(6 + 2)</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01751" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1751"><Highlight kind="normal">      </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// riscv64: c.ldsp rd, offset&#91;8:3&#93; =&gt; 2^(6 + 3)</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01752" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1752"><Highlight kind="normal">      </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">//          c.sdsp rs2, offset&#91;8:3&#93; =&gt; 2^(6 + 3)</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01753" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1753"><Highlight kind="normal">      </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">//          c.fldsp rd, offset&#91;8:3&#93; =&gt; 2^(6 + 3)</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01754" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1754"><Highlight kind="normal">      </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">//          c.fsdsp rs2, offset&#91;8:3&#93; =&gt; 2^(6 + 3)</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01755" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1755"><Highlight kind="normal">      </Highlight><Highlight kind="keyword">const</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> uint64&#95;t RVCompressLen = <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/riscvframelowering/#a8682aca3721b6e3f6152ad82b053e209">STI</a>.getXLen() &#42; 8;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01756" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1756"><Highlight kind="normal">      </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// Compared with amount (2048 - StackAlign), StackSize needs to</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01757" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1757"><Highlight kind="normal">      </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// satisfy the following conditions to avoid using more instructions</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01758" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1758"><Highlight kind="normal">      </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// to adjust the sp after adjusting the amount, such as</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01759" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1759"><Highlight kind="normal">      </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// StackSize meets the condition (StackSize &lt;= 2048 + RVCompressLen),</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01760" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1760"><Highlight kind="normal">      </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// case1: Amount is 2048 - StackAlign: use addi + addi to adjust sp.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01761" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1761"><Highlight kind="normal">      </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// case2: Amount is RVCompressLen: use addi + addi to adjust sp.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01762" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1762"><Highlight kind="normal">      </Highlight><Highlight kind="keyword">auto</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> CanCompress = &#91;&amp;&#93;(uint64&#95;t CompressLen) -&gt; </Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordtype">bool</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> &#123;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01763" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1763"><Highlight kind="normal">        </Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordflow">if</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> (StackSize &lt;= 2047 + CompressLen ||</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01764" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1764"><Highlight kind="normal">            (StackSize &gt; 2048 &#42; 2 - StackAlign &amp;&amp;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01765" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1765"><Highlight kind="normal">             StackSize &lt;= 2047 &#42; 2 + CompressLen) ||</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01766" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1766"><Highlight kind="normal">            StackSize &gt; 2048 &#42; 3 - StackAlign)</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01767" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1767"><Highlight kind="normal">          </Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordflow">return</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> </Highlight><Highlight kind="keyword">true</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal">;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01768" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1768"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01769" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1769"><Highlight kind="normal">        </Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordflow">return</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> </Highlight><Highlight kind="keyword">false</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal">;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01770" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1770"><Highlight kind="normal">      &#125;;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01771" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1771"><Highlight kind="normal">      </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// In the epilogue, addi sp, sp, 496 is used to recover the sp and it</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01772" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1772"><Highlight kind="normal">      </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// can be compressed(C.ADDI16SP, offset can be &#91;-512, 496&#93;), but</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01773" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1773"><Highlight kind="normal">      </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// addi sp, sp, 512 can not be compressed. So try to use 496 first.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01774" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1774"><Highlight kind="normal">      </Highlight><Highlight kind="keyword">const</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> uint64&#95;t ADDI16SPCompressLen = 496;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01775" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1775"><Highlight kind="normal">      </Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordflow">if</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> (<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/riscvframelowering/#a8682aca3721b6e3f6152ad82b053e209">STI</a>.is64Bit() &amp;&amp; CanCompress(ADDI16SPCompressLen))</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01776" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1776"><Highlight kind="normal">        </Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordflow">return</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> ADDI16SPCompressLen;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01777" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1777"><Highlight kind="normal">      </Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordflow">if</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> (CanCompress(RVCompressLen))</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01778" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1778"><Highlight kind="normal">        </Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordflow">return</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> RVCompressLen;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01779" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1779"><Highlight kind="normal">    &#125;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01780" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1780"><Highlight kind="normal">    </Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordflow">return</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> 2048 - StackAlign;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01781" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1781"><Highlight kind="normal">  &#125;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01782" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1782"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordflow">return</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> 0;</Highlight></CodeLine>
